title: Sherlock bosses reveal why Sunday's episode could be the last ever as series comes to an end
text:
TV Sherlock bosses reveal why Sunday's episode could be the last ever as series comes to an end Viewers on Sunday will watch the final episode of the current series called The Final Problem, although details have been kept under wraps Share This Sunday's Sherlock could be the last ever (Photo: BBC) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Sherlock bosses have admitted they may have filmed the last ever film of the hit BBC drama. 
Viewers on Sunday will watch the final episode of the current series called The Final Problem. 
At a preview screening on Thursday night at London’s BFI, co-creator Steven Moffat took the unusual step of talking about the overall Sherlock project and paying tribute to his wife, the show’s series producer Sue Vertue. 
He said afterwards: “If this is the last time, we are not planning it might be, it is possible. It could end there. 
“We couldn’t have ended it on any of the previous series because they always ending in walloping great cliffhangers. 
"If we never come back, there is one thing I would like to say, the boss and number one, is the person to whom I am married. 
“She is the person who runs all the show who either kicks us up the arse or restrains us and made us write it in the first place.” 
Fellow co-creator Mark Gatiss sounded emotional introducing the film and with his voice wavering said: “All we can say is this may be the final problem. Read More Martin Freeman reveals how his relationship is with Amanda Abbington as they split after 15 years There was a shock twist at the end of last week's episode (Photo: BBC) 
“If it is all we can say is thank you to an incredible team who have made Sherlock what it is today, an absolute phenomenon which has taken us all by surprise. It has been an amazing rollercoaster.” 
Gatiss also admitted it has “such a finale feel to it”. 
Bosses have asked that details of the plot for the episode are kept under wraps but they have teased the episode by stating: “Someone has been playing a very long game indeed and Sherlock and John Watson face their greatest ever challenge. Is the game finally over?” Benedict Cumberbatch as Sherlock (Photo: BBC) 
The problem the BBC and the writers have is the two stars of the show are hugely in demand in Hollywood and the UK. 
Lead actor Benedict Cumberbatch is extremely busy with seven films currently filming or to be filmed in the future with his name attached to them, making another Sherlock series seemingly impossible before around 2019.
